intro: Lyonnetia muricata, commonly known as the rough-leaved lyonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Lyonnetia muricata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
